title: Poem of the week: Supple Cord by Naomi Shihab Nye
text:
William Sieghart’s poetry pharmacy prescribes the perfect words to help you through your problems. This week: dealing with siblings

The subject of siblings comes up again and again at my poetry pharmacies, and it’s no wonder. For those of us blessed and cursed with siblings, there will never be anyone who knows us more deeply, or who can use that knowledge with more cruelty. Our siblings have known us all our lives, and they have done so without ever turning a blind eye to our flaws. Indeed, our flaws are probably the parts of us our siblings know best. Those, and our weak spots.

Many psychologists believe that the relationships we have with our siblings are as important as the ones we have...
description: William Sieghart’s poetry pharmacy prescribes the perfect words to help you through your problems.
